intro: Porana microsepala, commonly known as the small-sepal porana, is a flowering plant native to parts of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes many species of shrubs and herbs. The plant is characterized by its small, delicate flowers that typically bloom in clusters. Its leaves are opposite and often have a slightly hairy texture. Porana microsepala is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories.
